senses.de: The place, person, or thing from which something originates or is obtained.
senses.ex: The river is the source of water for the town.

Tips.title: Physical Origins
Tips.description: Refers to the actual beginning or starting point of a physical item or phenomenon.
Tips.example: Wine has its source in grapes.

Tips.title: Figurative Source
Tips.description: Used metaphorically to refer to the beginning of abstract concepts like ideas or feelings.
Tips.example: Curiosity was the source of his scientific discoveries.

Tips.title: Resource Association
Tips.description: Often associated with a resource that is provided or obtained from something.
Tips.example: The library is a great source of knowledge.

senses.de: A point where light, heat or other energy comes from.
senses.ex: The sun is our main source of light and heat.

Tips.title: Energy Context
Tips.description: The context is scientific or technical, related to where energy is produced or emitted.
Tips.example: A battery serves as a source of electricity for our devices.

Tips.title: Natural Phenomena
Tips.description: Can refer to natural phenomena like the sun, often in a scientific or educational context.
Tips.example: Geothermal vents are a source of energy deep underwater.

senses.de: In journalism, a person who gives information.
senses.ex: My source told me that there will be a big announcement coming soon.

Tips.title: Information Origin
Tips.description: In journalism, it indicates the beginning of news or information, often confidential.
Tips.example: A reliable source is vital for accurate journalism.

Tips.title: Confidentiality Noted
Tips.description: Sources in journalism may need to be protected for safety and confidentiality reasons.
Tips.example: The journalist kept the source's identity secret.

senses.de: In computing, the original code in which a software program is written.
senses.ex: The source code of this software is open for everyone to review and improve.

Tips.title: Tech Blueprint
Tips.description: In computing, the term often relates to the foundational code of software.
Tips.example: Developers checked the source for potential errors.

Tips.title: Open-Source Community
Tips.description: Refers to software whose source code is freely available and can be modified.
Tips.example: She contributed to an open-source project on GitHub.

Authority.wordDefinition:
Authority refers to a person or organization that has power or control over something. It is applicable in situations where a person or organization has the ability to make decisions or take actions that others must follow.

Authority is about power and control, while source is about finding the origin or starting point of something.

Basis.wordDefinition:
Basis refers to the foundation or fundamental starting point of something. It is applicable when referring to the underlying principles or concepts on which something is built or established.

For example, the basis of a mathematical equation or the basis of a legal argument.

In simpler terms, basis refers to the core or foundation of something, while source refers to where it comes from or begins.

Cause.wordDefinition:
Cause is used when talking about why something happens.

It describes the reason behind an event or action. For example, you might say that the cause of the traffic jam was an accident on the highway.

Cause explains why something happens, while source explains where something comes from.

Foundation.wordDefinition:
Foundation refers to the base or fundamental structure of something, while the word source refers to the origin or where something comes from.

For example, a building's foundation is the structure that supports the weight of the whole building, while a river's source is the place where the water starts flowing from.

Foundation is more applicable when talking about physical structures or the basis of something, while source is more applicable when talking about the origin or starting point of something, such as a concept or idea.

Fountainhead.wordDefinition:
Both fountainhead and source refer to the origin or beginning of something.

However, fountainhead specifically refers to a literal or metaphorical source of water or creativity, while source is more general and can refer to anything that provides information, energy, or materials.

For example, a fountainhead could be a natural spring or a person who creates new ideas, while a source could be a book, a company, or a river.

Fountainhead describes more unique or creative origins, while source is used for more common or practical origins.

Origin.wordDefinition:
Origin refers to the point or place where something begins, originates or starts.

It is usually related to the beginning of something, such as the origin of a language, culture or tradition. For example, the origin of English language can be traced back to Old English.

The word source refers to the origins or cause of something.

It is usually related to the origin of information, like the source of a news story. For example, the source of information for a newspaper article might be an interview, a research paper or a press release.

To summarize, origin refers to the start or beginning of something, whereas source refers to where something comes from or the cause of something.

Provider.wordDefinition:
Provider refers to a person or company that gives or supplies something, like a service or a product. For example, a healthcare provider gives medical services to patients.

So, while a provider gives something, a source is where that something comes from. They are not always interchangeable, and it's important to use the correct word depending on the context.

Root.wordDefinition:
Root refers to the basic or fundamental cause of something.

It is often used to describe the origin or starting point of a problem or issue. For example, the root cause of poverty may be traced back to a lack of education or access to resources.

Root describes the cause of a problem while source describes the origin of something positive.

quotes.Text: I might even go for walks, just kind of come up with ideas in my head and then even sleep over it. And, yeah, the next day, when I wake up in the morning, I feel like that's when the ideas come, because you kind of wake up fresh and clean. You're not influenced from music on the radio or any other source.
quotes.Title: German Composer
quotes.Name: Ramin Djawadi

quotes.Text: On the whole, I now see my work as being an expression of my spiritual life and, because I look at it that way, I have a different centre. I go through the stress and pressure, but I think I'm lucky because I come from a different source point.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Forest Whitaker

quotes.Text: No stream rises higher than its source. What ever man might build could never express or reflect more than he was. He could record neither more nor less than he had learned of life when the buildings were built.
quotes.Title: American Architect
quotes.Name: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.Text: Prayer is the beginning and the end, the source and the fruit, the core and the content, the basis and the goal of all peacemaking.
quotes.Title: Dutch Clergyman
quotes.Name: Henri Nouwen

quotes.Text: I drink life's happy water, which is bottled at the divine source.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Stephon Marbury

quotes.Text: The imagination is a pretty precious source of protection.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Nicholas Ray

quotes.Text: You must accept the truth from whatever source it comes.
quotes.Title: Spanish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Maimonides

quotes.Text: My husband is a huge source of support and love.
quotes.Title: Cuban Author
quotes.Name: Jennine Capó Crucet

quotes.Text: The natural world is a source of inspiration.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: Giles Deacon
